channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Notes from an Appraiser: Selecting works for ‘Wabi-Sabi’ exhibit was fun break from routine
item.description: Appraiser Cynthia Shaver juries O’Hanlon Center’s “Wabi-Sabi” exhibit in Mill Valley, celebrating beauty in imperfection with 60 selected works.
item.dc:creator: Cynthia Shaver

item.title: Belvedere's wildlife expert debunks coyote guide posted online
item.description: Belvedere’s wildlife expert warns a viral coyote-control guide misstates laws, risks illegal traps and promotes ineffective lethal measures.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Hessel

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A self-taught sculptor builds a 40-year career in bronze
item.description: Self-taught Tiburon sculptor Kirk McGuire, 65, crafts world-renowned bronze marine-life art — from giant squids to mermaids — in his home studio.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon adman John Crawford was behind SF Giants’ anti-mascot Crazy Crab
item.description: John Crawford, the Tiburon advertising executive who created the San Francisco Giants’ notorious anti-mascot Crazy Crab, died May 27 at his home following complications from multiple health issues.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Ex-Richardson Bay sanitary chief Frank Dittle oversaw changes across 30 years
item.description: Frank Dittle, who served nearly 30 years at the Richardson Bay Sanitary District and rose to district manager, died of cancer Aug. 7 at his home in Woodacre.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Caltrans poised to delay Tiburon Boulevard bike lanes over bus safety
item.description: Caltrans appears poised to delay controversial plans to install bike lanes along Tiburon Boulevard from Trestle Glen Boulevard to Blackfield Drive until fiscal 2027-2028.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez
